title: Coronation Street: Daniel is overcome with emotion as he bids farewell to wife Sinead at funeral
text:
Coronation Street's Daniel Osbourne will be seen fighting back tears as he attends his wife Sinead Tinker's funeral, following her death from cervical cancer.

Wearing a navy three-piece suit, the grieving widower – played by Rob Mallard, 27 – kneels at the site of his late wife's flower-covered grave as he takes a solitary moment to bid farewell to Sinead.

Making the sombre occasion all the more heart-wrenching, a white floral 'mummy' tribute rests at the side of the grave from tragic Sinead's baby son Bertie, who was in the midst of being read his bedtime story when she passed away.

Fighting back tears: Coronation Street's Daniel Osbourne will be seen fighting back tears as he attends his wife Sinead Tinker's funeral, following her death from cervical cancer

Pallbearers will be seen carrying Sinead's wicker casket – covered with flowers and decorated with multi-coloured ribbons – to her final resting place.

The scenes come after Sinead, played by Katie McGlynn, was seen losing her hard-fought battle with the devastating disease during Friday night's episode of Corrie.

Cast members of the popular ITV soap shot the funeral scenes earlier this month, with photographs of their emotional goodbye being made public on Sunday.

Battle: The scenes come after Sinead, played by Katie McGlynn, was seen losing her hard-fought battle with the devastating disease during Friday night's episode of Corrie

Getting into character as Daniel, Rob appeared in a sombre mood alongside stars including Bill Roache, who stars as Ken Barlow, and Colson Smith, who plays Sinead's cousin Craig Tinker.

All the male cast members wore suitably smart suits, with Colson opting for a red blazer over a speckled grey waistcoat.

And Alison King, 46, who plays Carla Connor, looked almost tearful as she sheltered under her hood.

Lisa George, who plays Sinead's aunt Beth Tinker, wore a faux fur coat underneath her own hood, while Rula Lenska looked characteristically glamorous as she dressed as her character Claudia Colby.

Solitary: Wearing a navy three-piece suit, the grieving widower – played by Rob Mallard, 27 – stands at the site of his late wife's flower-covered grave as he takes a solitary moment

Final resting place: Pallbearers will be seen carrying Sinead's wicker casket – covered with flowers and decorated with multi-coloured ribbons – to her final resting place

On Friday night, viewers were left in tears when Sinead died from cervical cancer, as the harrowing scenes saw her peacefully slip away with Daniel and their son Bertie at her side.

The scenes for her funeral com amid rumours that Rob's character could be set to leave the soap following his wife's death.

According to the Metro, Daniel's departure comes when he gets wrongly accused by Beth (Lisa George) of having an affair with Bethany (Lucy Fallon).

He therefore decides to take Bertie away on holiday to Scotland, with an upset Beth wondering if she will ever see her godson again.

The news comes after Katie McGlynn, 26, who played Sinead, struggled with grief and sought therapy after filming her death.

Untimely: Daniel is clearly seen grieving as he comes to terms with his wife's untimely death

Heart-wrenching: Making the sombre occasion all the more heart-wrenching, a white floral 'mummy' tribute rests at the side of the grave from tragic Sinead's baby son Bertie

She told The Sunday Mirror she struggled to cope with the aftermath of Sinead's passing, and 'couldn't stop crying' after saying goodbye to the character.

Speaking about her seven years on the soap, Katie admitted she's always felt an emotional attachment to Sinead, after she first landed the role at the age of just 19.

Describing the moment she stepped into the character's iconic footwear, the star that her life was engulfed by the quirky character.

Katie - who even wore her character's pyjamas when she watched Sinead's last episode - went onto say that after she saw the scene when her character was told she had weeks to live, her emotions got the better of her.

Struggling: Corrie star Katie has revealed she struggled with grief and sought therapy after filming Sinead's heartbreaking death of cervical cancer

Embattled: The actress revealed that after watching the scenes when Sinead learned she had weeks to live she 'couldn't stop crying'

'The next day I just kept crying. I couldn't stop. I ended up going to see a counsellor who told me that I was mourning Sinead,' Katie said.

'A month later I still feel like I'm really mourning her. It feels like waves of sadness coming over me.'

Katie added that she spoke with a mental health specialist, who suggested she write a letter to Sinead to provide some form of closure.

She added: 'One minute I'll be all right, then the next I'm in tears. It might sound weird, but to me Sinead has always been real.'

Katie also admitted that she sometimes hears Sinead's voice and sees a part of the character when she looks in the mirror.

Slipping away: Katie said of her reaction to Sinead's death, 'The next day I just kept crying. I couldn't stop. I ended up going to see a counsellor who told me that I was mourning Sinead'

She also revealed that filming had an effect on her physical state, and she put on a stone on weight after eating junk food.

As Katie reflected on her final days in Corrie, she openly said it was her idea that Sinead be killed off, to honestly portray the reality that not everyone survives their battle with cancer.

Viewers were distraught on Friday when Sinead lost her battle with cervical cancer, just days after being told that her husband Daniel had cheated on her.

While she decided to forgive Daniel so she could pass away in peace, Sinead's passing still proved difficult to watch for many viewers, as she quietly slipped away watching her husband read a story to their son Bertie.

Coronation Street continues on Monday at 7:30pm and 8:30pm on ITV.
